description: Both alerts indicate that the Product Catalog and Shipping services are not receiving requests. These services are part of the same application stack and are likely affected by a common issue, possibly related to frontend or network routing issues.
confidence_explanation: The confidence score is high due to the similarity in alert descriptions and the shared dependencies on the frontend service as per the topology data.
recommended_actions: Check the frontend service for issues as it routes traffic to these services.
Investigate network connectivity between the frontend and these services.
Review recent changes in the deployment or configuration of these services.
name: Product Catalog and Shipping Service No Requests

alerts.name: ProductCatalogServiceNoRequests
alerts.description: Product Catalog service has received no requests in the last 5 minutes.

annotations.summary: No requests to Product Catalog service

alerts.name: ShippingServiceNoRequests
alerts.description: Shipping service has received no requests in the last 5 minutes.

description: The alerts indicate that critical Kubernetes components (KubeControllerManager, KubeProxy, KubeScheduler) are down. This suggests a potential issue with the Kubernetes control plane, which could impact cluster operations.
confidence_explanation: The confidence score is very high due to the critical nature of the components involved and their direct impact on cluster operations.
recommended_actions: Check the status of the Kubernetes control plane nodes.
Review logs for the affected components to identify any errors or issues.
Ensure that the Kubernetes API server is operational and accessible.
name: Kubernetes Control Plane Components Down

description: These alerts indicate issues with Alertmanager failing to send notifications. The alerts have varying failure rates but are related to the same service, suggesting a persistent issue with the Alertmanager's ability to communicate with its notification endpoints.
confidence_explanation: The confidence score is high due to the consistent nature of the alerts related to the same service and issue type.
recommended_actions: Check the network connectivity and configuration of the Alertmanager's notification endpoints.
Review Alertmanager logs for any errors or timeouts.
Ensure that the webhook endpoints are operational and not overloaded.
name: Alertmanager Notification Failures

description: The Checkout service is experiencing no requests and frequent pod restarts. This suggests a potential issue with the service's stability or configuration, possibly affecting its ability to handle requests.
confidence_explanation: The confidence score is high due to the direct relationship between the no requests alert and the pod restarting issues, indicating a likely common root cause.
recommended_actions: Investigate the cause of the pod restarts for the Checkout service.
Check for resource constraints or configuration issues in the Checkout service deployment.
Review logs for any errors or exceptions in the Checkout service.
name: Checkout Service No Requests and Pod Restarting

description: The alerts indicate issues with the Frontend service, including high latency and deployment replica mismatches. These issues could be related to resource constraints or configuration problems affecting the service's performance.
confidence_explanation: The confidence score is moderate to high due to the related nature of the alerts affecting the same service, though the issues are different in nature (latency vs. replica mismatch).
recommended_actions: Check the resource usage and limits for the Frontend service.
Investigate any recent changes in the Frontend service deployment or configuration.
Review logs for any performance-related errors or warnings.
name: Frontend and Related Services Issues
